paragraph.paragraph: The Project Items folder (../../../../images/icons/project_items.ico) represents your project and all of it's project files, nothing more. It's purpose is to contain all project specific file items under one group, just as the ../eiffel_libraries/index.xmlEiffel Libraries folder purpose is to contain Eiffel libraries you would like to reuse from your project.

The Project Items folder is actually nothing more than a special clusters_and_items/explicit_clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folder and shares all of it's attributes and features. The difference between the Project Items folder and clusters_and_items/explicit_clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folders are:
The Project Items cannot be remove, just like all top-level folders in an EiffelEnvision ../project.xmlProject.
Project Items is not the name of the cluster. To change the Project Items folder cluster name, use the ../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlcluster_nameCluster Name property.
The Project Items cluster ../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlpathPath property cannot be changed.

For information on how to add one of the many new project file item templates or to add exiting files to your EiffelEnvision project , see ../../configuring/adding_items/index.xmlAdding New and Existing Items.
For information on adding clusters to the Project Items folder, see ../../configuring/adding_items/adding_clusters.xmlAdding New Clusters.

The Project Items folder has a context menu similar to the ../project.xmlProject node. To see what is available from the Project Items folder context menu, see context_menu.xmlProject Items Folder Context Menu.
